Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; UNSPECIFIED TECHNIQUE OF CERAMICS
Name: Vase decorated with the aid of the potter's wheel
Description: This vase of clay, whose provenance is not known, is a beautiful example of a ceramic decorated with the potter's wheel. The use of this technique which was of italic origin, was restricted in Egypt to the 1st and 2nd centuries of our time. The pieces belonged to a type of ceramics of the highest quality, which was particularly distinguished by its extremely thin walls.
